item.title: Fast QR Code Scanning on the Raspberry Pi Zero
item.description: http://blog.mafrog.info/lelectronique/raspberry-pi/installer-zbar-sur-raspberry-pi/ Download zbar from the official website / sourceforge (don’t use the git repo mirror on github). Make sure you have autoconf installed. bunzip2 zbar-0.10.tar.bz2 tar -xvf zbar-0.10.tar mkdir zbar-build cd zbar-build ../zbar-0.10/configure --prefix=/usr/local --disable-video --without-imagemagick --without-qt --without-gtk --without-python sudo echo /usr/local/lib > /etc/ld.so.conf.d/zbar.conf sudo ldconfig Compiling and installing raspicam is a bit more straightforward. git clone https://github.com/cedricve/raspicam.git cd raspicam mkdir build cd build cmake .. make sudo make install sudo ldconfig
